verses.verse: And it came to pass after this<WH310>, that Absalom<WH53> prepared<WH6213> him a chariot<WH4818> and horses<WH5483>, and fifty<WH2572> men<WH376> to run<WH7323> before him<WH6440>.

And Absalom<WH53> rose up early<WH7925>, and stood<WH5975> beside<WH3027> the way<WH1870> of the gate<WH8179>: and it was so<WH376>, that, when any man had a suit<WH7379> which should come<WH935> to the king<WH4428> for judgment<WH4941>, then Absalom<WH53> called<WH7121> unto him<WH559>, and said, Of what<WH335> city<WH5892> art thou<WH559>? And he said, Thy servant<WH5650> is of one<WH259> of the tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478>.
And Absalom<WH53> said<WH559> unto him<WH7200>, See, thy matters<WH1697> are good<WH2896> and right<WH5228>; but there is no man deputed of the king<WH4428> to hear thee<WH8085>.

Absalom <WH53> said<WH559> moreover<WH7760>, Oh that I were made judge<WH8199> in the land<WH776>, that every man<WH376> who hath any suit<WH7379> or cause<WH4941> might come<WH935> unto me<WH6663>, and I would do him justice!
And it was so<WH376>, that, when any man came nigh<WH7126> to do him obeisance<WH7812>, he put forth<WH7971> his hand<WH3027>, and took<WH2388> hold of him<WH5401>, and kissed him.

And on this manner<WH1697> did<WH6213> Absalom<WH53> to all Israel<WH3478> that came<WH935> to the king<WH4428> for judgment<WH4941>: so Absalom<WH53> stole<WH1589> the hearts<WH3820> of the men<WH582> of Israel<WH3478>.

And it came to pass at the end<WH7093> of forty<WH705> years<WH8141>, that Absalom<WH53> said<WH559> unto the king<WH4428>, I pray thee<WH3212>, let me go and pay<WH7999> my vow<WH5088>, which I have vowed<WH5087> unto Jehovah<WH3068>, in Hebron<WH2275>.

For thy servant<WH5650> vowed<WH5087> a vow<WH5088> while I abode<WH3427> at Geshur<WH1650> in Syria<WH758>, saying<WH559>, If Jehovah<WH3068> shall indeed bring me again<WH7725> to Jerusalem<WH3389>, then I will serve<WH5647> Jehovah<WH3068>.
And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto him<WH3212>, Go in peace<WH7965>. So he arose<WH6965>, and went<WH3212> to Hebron<WH2275>.

But Absalom<WH53> sent<WH7971> spies<WH7270> throughout all the tribes<WH7626> of Israel<WH3478>, saying<WH559>, As soon as ye hear<WH8085> the sound<WH6963> of the trumpet<WH7782>, then ye shall say<WH559>, Absalom<WH53> is king<WH4427> in Hebron<WH2275>.

And with Absalom<WH53> went<WH1980> two hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> out of Jerusalem<WH3389>, that were invited<WH7121>, and went<WH1980> in their simplicity<WH8537>; and they knew<WH3045> not anything<WH1697>.

And Absalom<WH53> sent<WH7971> for Ahithophel<WH302> the Gilonite<WH1526>, David<WH1732>'s counsellor<WH3289>, from his city<WH5892>, even from Giloh<WH1542>, while he was offering<WH2076> the sacrifices<WH2077>. And the conspiracy<WH7195> was strong<WH533>; for the people<WH5971> increased<WH7227> continually<WH1980> with Absalom<WH53>.
And there came<WH935> a messenger<WH5046> to David<WH1732>, saying<WH559>, The hearts<WH3820> of the men<WH376> of Israel<WH3478> are after<WH310> Absalom<WH53>.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> unto all his servants<WH5650> that were with him at Jerusalem<WH3389>, Arise<WH6965>, and let us flee<WH1272>; for else none of us shall escape<WH6413> from<WH6440> Absalom<WH53>: make speed<WH4116> to depart<WH3212>, lest he overtake<WH5381> us quickly<WH4116>, and bring<WH5080> down evil<WH7451> upon us<WH5221>, and smite the city<WH5892> with the edge<WH6310> of the sword<WH2719>.
And the king<WH4428>'s servants<WH5650> said<WH559> unto the king<WH4428>, Behold<WH5650>, thy servants are ready to do whatsoever my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> shall choose<WH977>.

And the king<WH4428> went forth<WH3318>, and all his household<WH1004> after<WH7272> him<WH4428>. And the king left<WH5800> ten<WH6235> women<WH802>, that were concubines<WH6370>, to keep<WH8104> the house<WH1004>.
And the king<WH4428> went forth<WH3318>, and all the people<WH5971> after<WH7272> him<WH5975>; and they tarried in<WH1004> Beth-merhak<WH4801>.

And all his servants<WH5650> passed on<WH5674> beside<WH3027> him<WH3774>; and all the Cherethites, and all the Pelethites<WH6432>, and all the Gittites<WH1663>, six<WH8337> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> that came<WH935> after<WH7272> him from Gath<WH1661>, passed on<WH5674> before<WH6440> the king<WH4428>.

Then said<WH559> the king<WH4428> to Ittai<WH863> the Gittite<WH1663>, Wherefore goest<WH3212> thou also with us<WH7725>? return, and abide<WH3427> with the king<WH4428>: for thou art a foreigner<WH5237>, and also an exile<WH1540>; return to thine own place<WH4725>.

Whereas thou camest<WH935> but yesterday<WH8543>, should I this day<WH3117> make thee go<WH3212> up and down<WH5128> with us<WH1980>, seeing I go whither I may<WH7725>? return thou<WH7725>, and take back thy brethren<WH251>; mercy<WH2617> and truth be with thee<WH571>.

And Ittai<WH863> answered<WH6030> the king<WH4428>, and said<WH559>, As Jehovah<WH3068> liveth<WH2416>, and as my lord<WH3068> the king<WH4428> liveth<WH2416>, surely in what place<WH4725> my lord<WH113> the king<WH4428> shall be<WH4194>, whether for death or for life<WH2416>, even there also will thy servant be<WH5650>.

And David<WH1732> said<WH559> to Ittai<WH863>, Go<WH3212> and pass over<WH5674>. And Ittai<WH863> the Gittite<WH1663> passed over<WH5674>, and all his men<WH582>, and all the little ones that were with him<WH2945>.

And all the country<WH776> wept<WH1058> with a loud<WH1419> voice<WH6963>, and all the people<WH5971> passed over<WH5674>: the king<WH4428> also himself passed over<WH5674> the brook<WH5158> Kidron<WH6939>, and all the people<WH5971> passed over<WH5674>, toward<WH6440> the way<WH1870> of the wilderness<WH4057>.

And <WH6659>, lo, Zadok also came<WH3881>, and all the Levites with him<WH5375>, bearing the ark<WH727> of the covenant<WH1285> of God<WH430>; and they set down<WH3332> the ark<WH727> of God<WH430>; and Abiathar<WH54> went up<WH5927>, until all the people<WH5971> had done<WH8552> passing<WH5674> out of the city<WH5892>.

And the king<WH4428> said<WH559> unto Zadok<WH6659>, Carry back<WH7725> the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> into the city<WH5892>: if I shall find<WH4672> favor<WH2580> in the eyes<WH5869> of Jehovah<WH3068>, he will bring me again<WH7725>, and show<WH7200> me both it<WH5116>, and his habitation:
but if he say<WH559> thus<WH2654>, I have no delight in thee<WH6213>; behold, here am I, let him do to me as seemeth<WH5869> good unto him<WH2896>.

The king<WH4428> said<WH559> also unto Zadok<WH6659> the priest<WH3548>, Art thou not a seer<WH7200>? return<WH7725> into the city<WH5892> in peace<WH7965>, and your two<WH8147> sons<WH1121> with you<WH290>, Ahimaaz thy son<WH1121>, and Jonathan<WH3083> the son<WH1121> of Abiathar<WH54>.
See <WH7200>, I will tarry<WH4102> at the fords<WH6160> of the wilderness<WH4057>, until there come<WH935> word<WH1697> from you to certify me<WH5046>.
Zadok <WH6659> therefore and Abiathar<WH54> carried<WH7725> the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> again<WH7725> to Jerusalem<WH3389>: and they abode there<WH3427>.

And David<WH1732> went up<WH5927> by the ascent<WH4608> of the mount of Olives<WH2132>, and wept<WH1058> as he went up<WH5927>; and he had his head<WH7218> covered<WH2645>, and went<WH1980> barefoot<WH3182>: and all the people<WH5971> that were with him covered<WH2645> every man<WH376> his head<WH7218>, and they went up<WH5927>, weeping<WH1058> as they went up<WH5927>.

And one told<WH5046> David<WH1732>, saying<WH559>, Ahithophel<WH302> is among the conspirators<WH7194> with Absalom<WH53>. And David<WH1732> said<WH559>, O Jehovah<WH3068>, I pray thee<WH6098>, turn the counsel of Ahithophel<WH302> into foolishness<WH5528>.

And it came to pass<WH1732>, that, when David was come<WH935> to the top<WH7218> of the ascent<WH430>, where God was worshipped<WH7812>, behold<WH2365>, Hushai the Archite<WH757> came to meet<WH7125> him with his coat<WH3801> rent<WH7167>, and earth<WH127> upon his head<WH7218>.
And David<WH1732> said<WH559> unto him<WH5674>, If thou passest on with me<WH4853>, then thou wilt be a burden unto me:

but if thou return<WH7725> to the city<WH5892>, and say<WH559> unto Absalom<WH53>, I will be thy servant<WH5650>, O king<WH4428>; as I have been thy father<WH1>'s servant<WH5650> in time past<WH227>, so will I now be thy servant<WH5650>; then wilt thou defeat<WH6565> for me the counsel<WH6098> of Ahithophel<WH302>.

And hast thou not there with thee Zadok<WH6659> and Abiathar<WH54> the priests<WH3548>? therefore it shall be<WH1697>, that what thing soever thou shalt hear<WH8085> out of the king<WH4428>'s house<WH1004>, thou shalt tell<WH5046> it to Zadok<WH6659> and Abiathar<WH54> the priests<WH3548>.

Behold <WH8147>, they have there with them their two sons<WH1121>, Ahimaaz<WH290>, Zadok<WH6659>'s son<WH3083>, and Jonathan, Abiathar<WH54>'s son<WH3027>; and by them ye shall send<WH7971> unto me everything<WH1697> that ye shall hear<WH8085>.
So Hushai<WH2365>, David<WH1732>'s friend<WH7463>, came<WH935> into the city<WH5892>; and Absalom<WH53> came<WH935> into Jerusalem<WH3389>.
